page.title: 13The three locks & A canalman
page.content: The{Three Locks}were built in 1868 and finished in 1879 following which the canalside pub was built in 1905 but it was originally just a hay barn for the horses then after it became a pub for the barges. The latest manager has been there for two years. He lives in the pub.{The canalman}doesn't live in the boat and he is a foreman builder.He is on the canal because he's on his annual holiday. He has no children. He saysthe water is cleaner since the last time he came. He drops in at all the pubs and he says this one has good service. For his holiday he and his wife set off from Bletchley and have been to Aylesbury. They have been going for four days. It is easy to steer the barge. He uses diesel fuel and a tank full will run for 50 hours.
